name: Project
title: Google
Cloud
Language
Project
description:
Project

Google Cloud Natural Language API reveals the structure and meaning of text by offering powerful machine learning models in an easy to use REST API. You can analyze text uploaded in your request or integrate with your document storage on Google Cloud Storage.

See Google::Cloud#language

examples.code:
require "google/cloud"

gcloud = Google::Cloud.new
language = gcloud.language

content = "Darth Vader is the best villain in Star Wars."
annotation = language.annotate content

annotation.sentiment.polarity #=> 1.0
annotation.sentiment.magnitude #=> 0.8999999761581421
annotation.entities.count #=> 2
annotation.sentences.count #=> 1
annotation.tokens.count #=> 10

require "google/cloud"

gcloud = Google::Cloud.new "my-project-id",
                           "/path/to/keyfile.json"
language = gcloud.language

language.project #=> "my-project-id"

methods.name: document
title: Google
Cloud
Language
Project#document
methods.description: Returns a new document from the given content. No API call is made.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud"

gcloud = Google::Cloud.new
language = gcloud.language

document = language.document "It was the best of times, it was..."

examples.caption: With a Google Cloud Storage URI:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud"

gcloud = Google::Cloud.new
language = gcloud.language

document = language.document "gs://bucket-name/path/to/document"

examples.caption: With a Google Cloud Storage File object:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud"

gcloud = Google::Cloud.new
storage = gcloud.storage

bucket = storage.bucket "bucket-name"
file = bucket.file "path/to/document"

language = gcloud.language

document = language.document file

examples.caption: With format and language options:
examples.code:
require "google/cloud" gcloud = Google::Cloud.new language = gcloud.language document = language.document "

El viejo y el mar

", format: :html, language: "es"

params.name: content
params.description: A string of text to be annotated, or a Cloud Storage URI of the form "gs://bucketname/path/to/document.ext"; or an instance of Google::Cloud::Storage::File of the text to be annotated.

params.name: format
params.description:
The format of the document (TEXT/HTML).
Optional.

params.name: language
params.description:
The language of the document (if not
specified, the language is automatically detected). Both ISO and
BCP-47 language codes are accepted. Optional.

returns.description: An document for the Language service.

methods.name: text
title: Google
Cloud
Language
Project#text
methods.description: Returns a new document from the given content with the format value :text. No API call is made.

params.name: content
params.description: A string of text to be annotated, or a Cloud Storage URI of the form "gs://bucketname/path/to/document.ext"; or an instance of Google::Cloud::Storage::File of the text to be annotated.

params.name: language
params.description:
The language of the document (if not
specified, the language is automatically detected). Both ISO and
BCP-47 language codes are accepted. Optional.

returns.description: An document for the Language service.

methods.name: html
title: Google
Cloud
Language
Project#html
methods.description: Returns a new document from the given content with the format value :html. No API call is made.

params.name: content
params.description: A string of text to be annotated, or a Cloud Storage URI of the form "gs://bucketname/path/to/document.ext"; or an instance of Google::Cloud::Storage::File of the text to be annotated.

params.name: language
params.description:
The language of the document (if not
specified, the language is automatically detected). Both ISO and
BCP-47 language codes are accepted. Optional.

returns.description: An document for the Language service.

methods.name: annotate
title: Google
Cloud
Language
Project#annotate
methods.description: Analyzes the content and returns sentiment, entity, and syntactic feature results, depending on the option flags. Calling annotate with no arguments will perform all analysis features. Each feature is priced separately. See Pricing for details.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud"

gcloud = Google::Cloud.new
language = gcloud.language

content = "Darth Vader is the best villain in Star Wars."
annotation = language.annotate content

annotation.sentiment.polarity #=> 1.0
annotation.sentiment.magnitude #=> 0.8999999761581421
annotation.entities.count #=> 2
annotation.sentences.count #=> 1
annotation.tokens.count #=> 10

params.name: content
params.description: The content to annotate. This can be an Document instance, or any other type that converts to an Document. See #document for details.

params.name: sentiment
params.description: Whether to perform the sentiment analysis. Optional. The default is false. If every feature option is false, all features will be performed.

params.name: entities
params.description: Whether to perform the entity analysis. Optional. The default is false. If every feature option is false, all features will be performed.

params.name: syntax
params.description: Whether to perform the syntactic analysis. Optional. The default is false. If every feature option is false, all features will be performed.

params.name: format
params.description:
The format of the document (TEXT/HTML).
Optional.

params.name: language
params.description:
The language of the document (if not
specified, the language is automatically detected). Both ISO and
BCP-47 language codes are accepted. Optional.

params.name: encoding
params.description:
The encoding type used by the API to
calculate offsets. Optional.

returns.description: ] The results for the content analysis.

methods.name: syntax
title: Google
Cloud
Language
Project#syntax
methods.description: Syntactic analysis extracts linguistic information, breaking up the given text into a series of sentences and tokens (generally, word boundaries), providing further analysis on those tokens.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud"

gcloud = Google::Cloud.new
language = gcloud.language

document = language.document "Hello world!"

annotation = language.syntax document
annotation.thing #=> Some Result

params.name: content
params.description: The content to annotate. This can be an Document instance, or any other type that converts to an Document. See #document for details.

params.name: format
params.description:
The format of the document (TEXT/HTML).
Optional.

params.name: language
params.description:
The language of the document (if not
specified, the language is automatically detected). Both ISO and
BCP-47 language codes are accepted. Optional.

params.name: encoding
params.description:
The encoding type used by the API to
calculate offsets. Optional.

returns.description: ] The results for the content syntax analysis.

methods.name: entities
title: Google
Cloud
Language
Project#entities
methods.description: Entity analysis inspects the given text for known entities (proper nouns such as public figures, landmarks, etc.) and returns information about those entities.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud"

gcloud = Google::Cloud.new
language = gcloud.language

document = language.document "Hello Chris and Mike!"

entities = language.entities document
entities.count #=> 2

params.name: content
params.description: The content to annotate. This can be an Document instance, or any other type that converts to an Document. See #document for details.

params.name: format
params.description:
The format of the document (TEXT/HTML).
Optional.

params.name: language
params.description:
The language of the document (if not
specified, the language is automatically detected). Both ISO and
BCP-47 language codes are accepted. Optional.

params.name: encoding
params.description:
The encoding type used by the API to
calculate offsets. Optional.

returns.description: ] The results for the entities analysis.

methods.name: sentiment
title: Google
Cloud
Language
Project#sentiment
methods.description: Sentiment analysis inspects the given text and identifies the prevailing emotional opinion within the text, especially to determine a writerâ€™s attitude as positive, negative, or neutral. Currently, only English is supported for sentiment analysis.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud"

gcloud = Google::Cloud.new
language = gcloud.language

document = language.document "Hello Chris and Mike!"

sentiment = language.sentiment document
sentiment.polarity #=> 1.0
sentiment.magnitude #=> 0.8999999761581421

params.name: content
params.description: The content to annotate. This can be an Document instance, or any other type that converts to an Document. See #document for details.

params.name: format
params.description:
The format of the document (TEXT/HTML).
Optional.

params.name: language
params.description:
The language of the document (if not
specified, the language is automatically detected). Both ISO and
BCP-47 language codes are accepted. Optional.

returns.description:
] The results for the sentiment
analysis.
